description: It is like a web version
works well, i can look at all my accounts easily, and looks great

Overall, Whalebird is pretty decent. It deals with multiple accounts well, is logically organized, and is easy to use. However, it doesn't support dark mode, which makes it unusable for me half of the time.
summary: Pretty good, but no dark mode

description: This is great as a Mastodon client, but it's missing some features like emoji reactions and markdown support that mean I can't really recommend it for anything else.
summary: Pretty great, though missing some Pleroma/Akkoma features

description: It's awesome, for me it's the best client
